Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.backend.repos.csv

CSV file-based repository implementation for ODP data storage.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CsvOdpFileManager
    File manager for handling CSV file I/O operations in the ODP repository.
    CsvOdpMapper
    Mapper class for converting between CSV records and ODP domain objects.
    CsvOdpRepository
    CSV-based implementation of the ODP repository.

Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.backend.repos.csv Description

CSV file-based repository implementation for ODP data storage.

Overview

This package provides a CSV (Comma-Separated Values) file-based implementation of the IOdpRepository interface. It stores ODP data and related entities in human-readable CSV files, making it suitable for prototyping, testing, and small-to-medium deployments.

Components

CsvOdpRepository

CsvOdpRepository is the main repository implementation that:

  • Implements all IOdpRepository methods
  • Coordinates CSV file reading/writing via CsvOdpFileManager
  • Performs data mapping via CsvOdpMapper
  • Manages in-memory caching for performance
  • Handles concurrent access and data consistency

CsvOdpFileManager

CsvOdpFileManager handles file I/O operations:

  • Reading CSV files into lists of string arrays
  • Writing lists of string arrays back to CSV files
  • Managing file paths and directory structure
  • Handling file locking and concurrent access
  • Creating backup copies before modifications

CsvOdpMapper

CsvOdpMapper handles data transformation:

  • Mapping CSV rows (String[]) to domain objects
  • Mapping domain objects to CSV rows (String[])
  • Handling data type conversions (dates, numbers, booleans)
  • Parsing and formatting enum values
  • Null value handling

File Structure

The CSV repository uses multiple files to store different entities: 

 repository_root/
 â”œâ”€â”€ odps.csv                  # Main ODP records
 â”œâ”€â”€ authorization_flows.csv   # Approval histories
 â”œâ”€â”€ companies.csv             # Company master data
 â”œâ”€â”€ currencies.csv            # Currency codes
 â”œâ”€â”€ suppliers.csv             # Supplier master data
 â”œâ”€â”€ cdcs.csv                  # Cost centers
 â”œâ”€â”€ cdrs.csv                  # Revenue centers
 â”œâ”€â”€ account_vds.csv           # Account/VDS data
 â”œâ”€â”€ user_roles.csv            # User-role mappings
 â””â”€â”€ passwords.csv             # User password hashes

CSV File Format

odps.csv

 id,stato,dataCompilazione,azienda,valuta,fornitore,cdc,cdr,...
 ODP-001,DRAFT,2025-01-15,001,EUR,SUP001,CDC01,CDR01,...
 ODP-002,WAITING_AUTH_SIGNER_1,2025-01-16,001,EUR,SUP002,CDC02,CDR02,...

authorization_flows.csv

 odpId,stepNumber,userId,approved,date,notes
 ODP-001,1,signer1,true,2025-01-16T10:30:00,Approved
 ODP-001,2,payer1,true,2025-01-16T14:45:00,Approved for payment

user_roles.csv

 userId,role
 user001,PROPOSER
 user002,SIGNER_1
 user003,PAYER

Features

In-Memory Caching

The repository caches frequently accessed data:

  • All ODPs loaded on first access
  • Reference data (companies, currencies, etc.) cached
  • Cache invalidated on write operations

Search and Filtering

Search operations filter cached data in memory:

  • Filter by company, state, owner, assignee, date ranges
  • Sort by configurable columns
  • Pagination support

ID Generation

Auto-generates unique ODP IDs using pattern: ODP-NNN

Concurrency

Uses file locking or synchronized blocks to prevent corruption during concurrent writes.

Data Integrity

  • Validates foreign key references (company codes, user IDs, etc.)
  • Creates backup files before modifications
  • Atomic writes using temporary files and rename

Advantages

  • Simplicity - No database server required
  • Human-Readable - Data can be viewed/edited in spreadsheet applications
  • Portability - Easy to backup, transfer, version control
  • Development-Friendly - Quick setup, no schema migrations
  • Testing - Easy to create test data fixtures

Limitations

  • Scalability - Not suitable for large datasets (thousands of records)
  • Concurrency - Limited support for concurrent writes
  • Transactions - No true ACID transaction support
  • Complex Queries - Limited query capabilities compared to SQL
  • Performance - Linear search performance, no indexing

Usage Example

Creating Repository


 // Create repository pointing to CSV directory
 String csvPath = "/data/odp/csv";
 CsvOdpRepository repository = new CsvOdpRepository(csvPath);

 // Use through service layer
 IOdpService service = IOdpServiceFactory.createOdpService(csvPath);

Direct File Access


 // Read CSV file
 CsvOdpFileManager fileManager = new CsvOdpFileManager(csvPath);
 List<String[]> rows = fileManager.readOdpsFile();

 // Map to domain objects
 List<Odp> odps = rows.stream()
     .map(CsvOdpMapper::mapToOdp)
     .collect(Collectors.toList());

 // Modify and write back
 odps.get(0).setImporto(2000.00);
 List<String[]> updatedRows = odps.stream()
     .map(CsvOdpMapper::mapFromOdp)
     .collect(Collectors.toList());
 fileManager.writeOdpsFile(updatedRows);

Migration Path

To migrate from CSV to RDBMS:

  1. Implement RdbmsOdpRepository with same interface
  2. Create migration utility to import CSV data into database
  3. Update IOdpServiceFactory to create RDBMS repository
  4. No changes required in service or frontend layers
Version:
3.0
Author:
RDS Software
